page.title: 06PARISH COUNCIL CLAXBY
page.content: Five councillors, one Clerk/Treasurer and a West Lindsey District councillor attend meetings approximately seven times a year when all matters relating to the parish and community are discussed. The press and public may attend these meetings and occasionally public meetings are called. Subjects discussed include obstructions to footpaths, the playing field, street lighting, sewage problems and road safety. Copies of planning applications for the village are observed, discussed and returned to the Planning Officer at West Lindsey District Council together with objections for consideration. A sum of money is allocated annually to be used for stationary, postage, telephone calls, insurance and upkeep of the churchyard, also for the good of the community.
